item.title: Codes of Conduct need to learn from OSS Licenses
item.author: Zev.Goldstein@gmail.com (Zev Goldstein)
item.description: Disclosure: I’m a fan of codes of conduct, but I’ve done my best to present both sides fairly. If you aren’t already familiar with codes of conduct and the conflicts around them, you may want to go read this article first. Codes of conduct, or CoCs, are one of the most contentius topics in open source right now. Every time a project considers adopting or changing their CoC, the discussion inevitably devolves into a heated debate about whether codes of conduct are universally good or evil.

item.title: About me
item.author: Zev.Goldstein@gmail.com (Zev Goldstein)
item.description: I’m a full-stack polyglot developer currently residing in Morgantown, WV. When I’m not coding, you can find me playing music or devil’s advocate. I’m particularly well versed in Go, PWAs, and Firebase. Contact me if you are looking for a speaker on one of these topics. Appleseed.vote - CEO and cofounder I’m currently the CEO and cofounder of Appleseed.vote. We are a voting startup building a better way to vote directly on issues you care about.
